means: 使着迷(charm的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: He has charmed most of them into membership of his fan club.
sentence.Network_cn: 他施展魅力，让他们大部分人都加入了他的支持者行列。

sentence.Network_en: He charmed his way out of trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 他运用自己的魅力摆脱了麻烦。

sentence.Network_en: The wicked old woman charmed the princess with magic words.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个老巫婆用咒语控制了公主.

entry.tran: (地点、时间或场合)让人心醉的，迷人的，令人愉快的
entry.def: A charmed place, time, or situation is one that is very beautiful or pleasant, and seems slightly separate from the real world or real life.

example.ex: ...the charmed atmosphere of Oxford in the late Twenties.

entry.tran: 总能逢凶化吉;一向遇难呈祥
entry.def: If you say that someone leads or has a charmed life, you mean that they always seem to be lucky, as if they are protected or helped by magic.

auth_sentence.content: Find out how Ted was charmed by black bears.

auth_sentence.content: From the outside, they led a charmed life.
